title: Firefox displaying fonts and some formatting incorrectly
content:
I didn't change or adjust anything, but when I opened Firefox this morning some websites are displaying differently. On some websites, the font size is smaller than 'normal' (see attached Wikipedia screenshots), some font styles have been changed (see attached Serebii and Archive of Our Own screenshots), and some websites are not displaying properly (see attached tumblr screenshots). I have cleared my cookies, cleared my browsing history, reset my browsing and font preferences, disabled all of my add-ons,disconnected from my VPN, logged out and back into Firefox, restarted my computer, and uninstalled and reinstalled Firefox, but the issue still persists.

I'm aware I can custom adjust the font size, which solves the sizing issue, but not the display or changed font.

I've included screenshots of the issues, as well as Chrome screenshots for comparison.

Is there anything else I can do to fix this? Thank you for the help!!

creator: leons.petrazickis

title: Font Size of main content on all sites renders at 13px after waking from sleep
content:
All of a sudden, after waking my computer from sleep, I found that many websites in Firefox are displaying the main text content at 13px, ignoring font sizes specified in CSS etc. I first discovered this on my organization's website, I thought it was a browser cache issue, but it has persisted. The text content on our front page is all the correct size, but everything on the website that is "main content" text that is not in a heading tag, like blog post or regular page content, is rendered at 13px. Other sites like Wikipedia load this way as well. In private mode, the issue disappears. In Chrome, the issue does not occur.

I have cleared all cookies, browser cache, site data, history, and the problem persists. I have checked the default font settings in Firefox, the checkbox saying websites should override the font settings is already checked. Zoom is set to 100%. I updated to the latest version in the course of restarting, and it didn't fix the issue either.

In the attached screenshot, the examples on the left are in regular Firefox windows. On the top right, a page on our site is displayed correctly in Firefox private mode. In the bottom right, Wikipedia is displayed correctly in Google Chrome.
creator: zbCanAdv

title: Need Human Support. Is that possible?
content:
My Firefox has intermittently (but many times a day) been been slow loading, often simply refusing to load at all. Clicking a link to open in a new tab often opens the tab but the tab says "New Tab" with an oscillating dot on the left. After a few minutes the dot stops and nothing displays. Often clicking something in Google News the new tab says "Opening " and then the Google URL. The page sometimes displays after a couple of minutes but sometimes never does.

I've disabled all my plugins except LastPass, but that doesn't help. My IT Support company hasn't been able to help. I tweeted Firefox and they suggested I DM them. I've done that, even sending a couple of illustrative screen videos. But no oikne has ever responded to my Twitter DM.

Is there any way to talk to a live person and share my screen to get some help?

If not, I'll need to abandon Firefox as my default browser after many, many years. It's become a real productivity-killer.

title: Wix site is really, really slow
content:
I see others have asked this question, but Firefox responders suggest solutions which have nothing to do with the problem. The problem isn't with Wix or website designers who use this service.

There is no slowness problem using Wix in the Chrome or Edge browsers. This means the problem is with the Firefox browser.

I have never had this slowness problem with Wix before recently, within the last month or so.

I ask you to consider that a recent Firefox update may be at fault.

Please fix this problem. I much prefer to use Firefox as my browser, but if I have to switch to Chrome to use Wix, which plays a significant part in my work, I might as well change over to Chrome completely. That would be a shame, since I've been a Firefox user for many years.

title: Youtube music is very muffled and quiet
content:
Greetings, Lately at v104 onwards the Youtube video sound is muffled, I've tried several solutions that are frequently the source of issue like hardware issue(tried a pair of brand new headphones), volume mixer is at the same level of system and everything else other than Firefox sounds reasonably loud, driver reinstallation, removed cache and preference etc.

Last I checked with other browsers for instance Chrome and Edge which are Chromium based and compared both with the same videos but they do not have this issue, so I can confidently say this is Firefox's issue. Hopefully this can be solved.

PS: I did saw one of the older bug tracker forum 3 years ago did mention something like force video to run a different encoder that isn't AV01 in about:config , I did not attempt it as I found it uncomfortable to edit and potentially break my browser.

title: Difficult to investigate AV flagging infections from within cache2\entries\
content:
Hi all,

Seeing a few files getting flagged by AV from within the \appdata\...\cache2\entries\ location, trouble is cannot investigate further / quarantine / whitelist, because of the nature of the cached files, rendered as a series of letters/numbers, without extension... they also appear to be auto-deleted before it's possible for AV to interrogate further.

Presuming chances are these are false-positive flags, but would be good to be able to verify this one way or another.

Similar files seem to exist for Firefox users generally, but vast majority are not currently flagged.

Any thoughts/ideas/similar experiences appreciated...

title: Problema no som com certos vídeos
content:
Olá,

Desde as 2 últimas actualizações (não tenho a certeza se começou na 103), que quando ouço o som de um vídeo no Firefox, o mesmo tem quebras constantes, aparentemente, de volume. Já desinstalei e voltei a instalar o Firefox mas o problema persiste. Isto só se nota quando corro um vídeo de ruído constante, como o "brown noise". Com vídeos normais isso não se nota. Tirei que instalar uma versão mais antiga ou há solução para isto? Noutros browsers não tenho esse problema.

Cumprimentos Vitor

title: missing icon for OneTab and 1Password
content: I fear I will use the wrong terminology -- computers are absolutely not my specialty. I have OneTab and I LOVE it! I still have the OneTab icon/link on the top LEFT of my screen. Clicking that drops down a list of sites that I can load. But the identical icon/link that used to appear on the top RIGHT side of the screen is gone. I was able to click this when I was shutting down my system. Clicking it would close the open sites and put them in the list I can access on the left. (I told you I don't know the right names for things. Sorry!!!) I can't use OneTab without that right-side icon/link. I also lost the 1Password icon/link. How do I get these back? I still have the Pocket icon/link, the download arrow, the Firefox account icon, and the "hamburger" on the right, but I really want the OneTab and 1Password clickable icon/links. Simple instructions, please! Thank you!
creator: sajudy2

title: Can NOT download .zip archives from usual spot on my iMac, I CAN download the images
content:
I frequent Creative Fabrica a lot, I have had a subscription there for well over a year and never had any problem downloading anything, never had so much as a warning about the website. This website is larger than Creative Market. I purchased the ability to download in a subscription there, my payments are all made on time.

Even then, I am trying to download free "daily gifts" (fonts & graphics), and this is the first time I have tried on my iMac, but FireFox does nothing, and I cannot download the .zip archive, even though I can download the image files.

I have been downloading from elsewhere across the internet just fine. I usually use FireFox because I like it better than Safari (and a lot more than Chrome or Chrome Edge), until this issue.

So, what's the deal?

I heard about restarting in safe mode, but have no idea how, I always have such an issue getting FireFox to restart for updates, already (and why doesn't it offer the button to do just that?).
creator: DomainHostmaster

title: Firefox closes/crashes when scrolling up with scrollbar
content:
I'm repeatedly having an issue where if I use the scroll bar to scroll up quickly my firefox closes, but it doesn't get reported as a crash. If I immediately try to open firefox again it tells me the old one is still running but not responding so I have to click close to open a new session. This has been happening for weeks now.

I considered that maybe there's some kind of interaction with the exit button since it is above the scroll bar and this only happens when I try to scroll up fast and far, but I've not been able to recreate this issue manually, releasing right click doesn't close the browser even if I hover over the x so I have no explanation on why this happens.

Please help, thanks.
creator: vash854
